dpmCompetition
Class Navigation

java.lang.Object
  dpmCompetition.Navigation

public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object

Provides an abstraction layer to access the robot's navigation capabilities.

Method Detail

turnTo

public void turnTo(double theta)
Turns the robot on itself to a specific angle position. The angle increases counterclockwise. Returns once the robot has finished turning.

Parameters:
theta - the angle position (in degrees)

turnTo

public void turnTo(double theta,
                   boolean immediateReturn)
Turns the robot on itself to a specific angle position. The angle increases counterclockwise.

Parameters:
theta - the angle position (in degrees)
immediateReturn - true if the method should return without waiting for the robot to finish turning

turn

public void turn(double theta)
Turns the robot on itself by a certain amount of degrees. The angle increases counterclockwise. Returns once the robot has finished turning.

Parameters:
theta - the amount of degrees to turn (in degrees)

turn

public void turn(double theta,
                 boolean immediateReturn)
Turns the robot on itself by a certain amount of degrees. The angle increases counterclockwise.

Parameters:
theta - the amount of degrees to turn (in degrees)
immediateReturn - true if the method should return without waiting for the robot to finish turning

turn

public void turn(double theta,
                 boolean immediateReturn,
                 int speed)
Turns the robot on itself by certain amount of degress and at a certain rotate speed

Parameters:
theta - the amount of degrees to turn (in degrees)
immediateReturn - true if the method should return without waiting for the robot to finish turning
speed - the speed that the robot turns

goForward

public void goForward(double distance)
Makes the robot go forward by a certain distance. Returns once the robot has finished turning.

Parameters:
distance - the distance in centimeters

goForward

public void goForward()
Makes the robot go forward. It will never stop until stopMoving() is called.

turnLeft

public void turnLeft()
Makes the robot turn on itself to the left. It will never stop until stopMoving() is called.

turnRight

public void turnRight()
Makes the robot turn on itself to the right. It will never stop until stopMoving() is called.

stopMoving

public void stopMoving()
Stops the robot from moving. Stops the two wheel motors.

isMoving

public boolean isMoving()
Used to check if the robot is currently moving

Returns:
true if the robot is moving.

minimalAngleDifference

public static double minimalAngleDifference(double currentTheta,
                                            double targetTheta)
Calculates the minimal angle the robot needs to turn in order to get to the target theta. Used in turnTo(double).

Parameters:
currentTheta - the robot's current angle position (in degrees)
targetTheta - the target angle position (in degrees)
Returns:
the minimal angle the robot needs to turn to reach the target angle position (in degrees)

convertAngle

private static double convertAngle(double radius,
                                   double width,
                                   double angle)
Calculates how much degrees the wheels should turn to make the robot turn a certain number of degrees on itself. This code comes from the code given in lab 2.

Parameters:
radius - the wheels (cm)
width - the distance between the two wheels (cm)
angle - the desired angle to turn (degrees)
Returns:
the amount of degrees the wheels should turn (in degrees)

convertDistance

private static double convertDistance(double radius,
                                      double distance)
Calculates how much degrees the wheels should turn to cover a given distance (cm) This code comes from the code given in lab 2.

Parameters:
radius - the wheels (cm)
distance - the desired distance (cm)
Returns:
the amount of degrees the wheels should turn (in degrees)
